abstract.p: Rivalry between nation's two largest bookstore chains continues in Paramus, New Jersey, where Borders is set to open superstore near two Barnes & Nobles stores (S)

block.p: The rivalry between the country's two largest bookstore chains is popping up in Paramus, N.J., with the Borders Group, the No. 2 bookseller, soon to open a superstore that could draw customers from two nearby Barnes & Noble superstores.

A 25,000-square-foot Borders Books and Music store is scheduled for a fall opening at Paramus Towne Square. Richard Brunelli, president of R. J. Brunelli & Company, the retail leasing firm that arranged the lease, said yesterday that there were two Barnes & Noble superstores in the Paramus area, one about two miles north of the Borders site and the second about half a mile south.
